page.title: 11C.H.BINDER OF MORETON
page.content: C.H.Binder is an agricultural industry whose main business is working with topsoil.They collect the soil from local farms taking the top 2 inches of soil from the grass fields.The soil is transported back to C.H.Binder by lorry where it is stored in heaps.Then it is sifted or screened and perhaps sterilised according to the customers requirement.Sometimes special mixtures such as sand and peat are required.The finished product is then transported by lorry to its final destination which could be football pitches, cricket tables,golf courses and bowling greens.Lords and the Oval have contracts with C.H.Binder.They employ ten people.If all the lorries are in use,C.H.Binder use other contractors for transporting the soil.The lorries they have include a 20 ton 8-wheel lorry and a 15 ton 6-wheel lorry.
